text.section: Subject to the restrictions of this subtitle, the Department or Authority may impose the terms and conditions on financial assistance from the Fund as either considers appropriate.

section.section: Except as provided in paragraph (2), (3), or (4) of this subsection, financial assistance from the Fund may not exceed 70% of the total costs of the project being financed.

Financial assistance from the Fund may constitute 100% of the total costs of the project being financed if:
the recipient is the Corporation; or
the financial assistance is for:
an arts and entertainment enterprise;
an arts and entertainment project; or
a qualified distressed county project.

Except as provided in subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, financial assistance from the Fund:
may be used to finance up to 50% of the costs of construction, purchase, or renovation of real property, fixtures, or equipment related to a child care facility; but
may not be used for working capital, supplies, or inventory related to a child care facility.

Financial assistance from the Fund may be used to finance up to 20% of the costs described in subparagraph (i) of this paragraph incurred by a business that has received or will receive a day care loan insured by the Maryland Industrial Development Financing Authority.

Financial assistance for preparation of a strategy or plan for economic development of a county or municipal corporation may not exceed:
50% of the costs of preparation; or
$50,000 in a 3-year period.

A loan from the Fund shall bear an interest rate below the market rate of interest, as determined by the Department, if the loan is for:
a significant strategic economic development opportunity; or
a specialized economic development opportunity.
A loan from the Fund for a qualified distressed county project shall bear an interest rate determined by the Department or the Authority.

A loan from the Fund shall bear an interest rate not exceeding one-eighth of 1% plus the net interest cost of the most recent State general obligation bond issue preceding the approval of the loan if the loan is:
for a local economic development opportunity; or
to a local government.

A loan from the Fund may not bear an interest rate of less than 3% unless:
the project funded by the loan is located in an area of high unemployment; or
the Department determines that the borrower is carrying out a compelling economic development initiative.
The Department may waive interest during the first 2 years of the term of a loan from the Fund.
If a borrower defaults on a loan from the Fund, the Department may impose an interest rate that exceeds the limits set forth in subsection (c)(1) or (3) of this section.
